answers.answer: Hi. NO it does not mean you have cancer. It means you have low Vit D and high cholesterol! VERY common with any thyroid patient!!!I had Hurthle Cell adenoma so I know what you are going through.Did you doctor do the Free T3 and Free T4 tests as well. Only having a TSH test is not going to tell the whole picture if you medication is working or not. Most doctors like to keep the TSH down to under 1.0 when a person has had a cancer. But again without the other tests you won;t know if your medication is actually effective.I hope the doctor now has you on some Vit D supplements? You would find your calcium would be low if that was tested too, a Vit D is responsible for you body absorbing calcium, without it you will more than likely be low on calcium too.Having high blood sugar is something you need to discuss too, as that could be a warning of diabetes.Good luck.

question: Hello, back in December I had half my thyroid removed and hertel cell cancer was found.  My Endocronologist doctor put me on synthroid to keep my tsh level low and I am under close watcch ever six months to see if I will need to have the rest of my thyroid removed and radiation treatment.  In march my TSH level was .5 and no other levels were looked at. Yet, I went to my general doctor and asked for a full blood test to be taken and I just got back the resutls. Now in June my TSH is 1.9 .and my vitamin D level is very low and my bad cholesterol is very high and my blood suger is really high.  What is going on? what should I do? Does this mean I have cancer again?
title: Low level vitamin D
